intro: Synammia espinosae, commonly known as the Espinoza's synammia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its unique morphology includes a short, woody stem and hairy foliage. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
